column5: Greetings, I recently watched the episode on youtube for the show filmed on Anishinabi Lake (spelling ?) - very interesting and entertaining. I saw the segments of the show that featured guide John J. I had the clear suspicion that I met this guide somewhere along the way based on his appearance and voice. Since watching the show, I've been trying to remember where I might have met John. ProV: I met a guide at Manotak Lodge on Perrault Lake about five years. This would have been early in the season. This guide and I had a nice conversation at the dock late one afternoon. Per chance, might that guide have been you? If not, I have no idea where we might have met one another. Very kindest regards....

Although i do guide on Perrault Lake that wasnt me at Manotak Lodge.I do guide at the camps on Cedar Lake and that is how i get to Perrauĺt.I guide at a number of camps from Eagle Lake to Lac Suel either in a camp boat or in my own boat including Clay Lake and the Indian Lake chain.Might of met somewhere along that route.Changing up lakes really keeps it interesting for me.The show was fun.Troy is a really nice guy and loves his fishing.We caught a lot of fish on that show just didnt come up with any big ones and can only show a few of each.Only spent a day and a half fishing and day 2 was not a nice day wind wise.But thats fishing.Where do you normally stay.

Greetings,I fished for many years on Perrault Lake from Manotak Lodge. I now am fishing on Stormer and Kirkness Lakes from Stormer Lake Lodge. Meeting you at Manotak Lodge was my best guess as to where I might have met you. Now, I'm thinking it might have been at one of the sport/All Canada shows.Good fishing and tight lines!!p.s. There are some really interesting shows on the website for The Ontario Experience. I watch a youtube video most days while eating lunch.
Yes very well could have been.i take care of the Anishinabi Lake Lodge booth at the Pheasant run in St Charles.
John when do u think you can make it to the deluxe ice shack,we will be in it about half hour before sunrise Friday?.But will arrive Thursday late afternoon,rod
Ill see if i can get there around that time.i
Ok John,if not that early come whenever,rod
Glad to hear that.i missed it yesterday and today.but on 2 more times.
Rod i have never fished in big shack.lol.it will be a first for me.if weather is good we can drill holes outside to.
I'll make Swiss cheese out of the ice away from the shack lol
Was he catching the smallies on Halverson Lake or was it on Annishinabi?
The ones he caught on show were from halverson.but we caught a bunch in the area by willuams narrows cabin and some pounts on main lake but those never made it on the show.
Good show. Surprised they never showed the Williams Outpost, that is a cool looking cabin and location.
Thats a awesome cabin and lòcation.we fished there and some film was taking.but can only put so much on a show.
Great episode John!
John I'm all packed,gotta lot of secret lures packed lol,be up there late afternoon Thursday,rod
Sounds good.
Show is on this week from anishinabi lake with troy lindner and myself.sportsmans channel.
Can't wait to see it! I love the Ontario Experience and Angling Edge.
I missed it this morning.got to watch the time zones.lol.

Thanks for the heads up. I'm planning to watch it, but I don't get the Sportsman's channel. So I always end up having to wait a week before the videos are uploaded to YouTube or to the Ontario Experience webpage. And then I watch the episodes on my phone while I'm doing my treadmill workouts. They usually upload the most recent episode on Thursday or Friday every week, so it will be another 2 or 3 days before I can watch the episode. But I'm looking forward to checking it out...

And here's the link to where I usually watch Troy Lindner's Ontario Experience. As of today, they have only uploaded the first 9 episodes of the 2020 TV season. The Clark's Camp episode (at Anishinabi) is episode #10. As I mentioned in the previous reply, I'm expecting this episode to be available online by about Thursday or Friday of this week, as that seems to be when they usually upload their most recent episodes....http://theontarioexperience.tv/watch-episodes/
I might have to watch it later as well.not always home when its on.ill be on the lake today and will miss it.
Awesome info. !!!! Thanks for posting it. PjShorthorn
John do u have a movie camera? You can film me pounding on the fish next week then we can send it to al Linder to air it,rod
Looks like it's available for viewing now:https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=kziD...re=emb_rel_end
Just watched it--great episode!
